item.title: Manager, Rapid Prototyping and UX Development, Intact Lab
item.description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best:  helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.

At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer.  You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.
About the role

About you:

Do you like working with cutting edge technology to find solutions or opportunities that push up the innovation curve? Do you enjoy a fast-paced environment that allows you to experiment and fail fast? Are you a proven people and project leader with a highly collaborative spirit? Do you thrive in facilitating creative innovation within large organizations? Do you think that leveraging a Design System is the perfect way to accelerate software development and increase accessibility? We’ve got the perfect opportunity for you!

 

Role:

As a Manager, Rapid Prototyping and UX Development, you will lead an innovation practice by finding and testing new ideas and quickly designing, developing and testing functional prototypes. You will also lead a team of web and mobile developers that nourish the Design System to accelerate the work of other developers across the company. You’ll help teams develop relevant new skills and help influence long-term roadmaps. 

 

Your main responsibilities are:

  • Manage, mentor and inspire a team of web and mobile developers as well as multidisciplinary, rotating teams.
  • Define and put in place the development strategy for the Design System. Educate and influence partners and boost adoption of the Design system.
  • Organize and facilitate cross-functional research and ideation activities throughout the company.
  • Work with management stakeholders to identify the most promising ideas and ensure their buy-in.
  • Work with managers to equip the Rapid Prototyping team with temporary talent through rotation.
  • Design and build functional prototypes ready to go into production as pilot, measuring impact and communicating their performance.
  • Manage the deployment and operationalization of prototypes with business partners such as development teams, marketing, legal services, security, procurement, operations and others.
  • Coach and develop new skills within a multidisciplinary team made up of product, design and insurance specialists.
  • Work with external vendors, start-ups and our nationwide brokerage community to identify opportunities for collaboration.
  • Draw, plan and execute roadmaps.
  • Cultivate relationships with leadership that facilitate achieving customer-centric outcomes.
Qualifications

What you bring to the table:

  • Graduate studies in a design, engineering and software development related discipline.
  • Experience with integrating an innovation culture or experience implementing cutting-edge technologies. 
  • Hands-on experience on product development.
  • Experience managing a team.
  • Curious, bold, empathic, and strategic mindset.
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills in both English and French.
  • Demonstrated initiative, negotiating and coaching skills.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Strong customer service focus.
  • You enjoy working in an inspiring and creative environment and having fun!

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: (For temporary roles, please remove any benefits that will not be offered)

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office. 

#hybrid
Closing Statement

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

item.title: Security Advisor, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day.

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Are you passionate about security and more specifically about the security of web and mobile applications? Do the words \'vulnerability\' and \'cloud\' resonate with you? Then we have the perfect role for you!

Intact Financial Corporation (IFC) is looking for a Security Advisor for our Intact Lab department. We are looking for a person who will represent the Lab in various processes that require security knowledge.

In this role, you will help identify security events that need to be monitored, analyze the risks associated with the various possible solutions, and propose a security solution to the operational problem that balances the potential loss and cost of the solution.

You will be responsible for identifying IT compliance monitoring gaps and overseeing the documentation, implementation, and testing for the entire IT compliance monitoring portfolio for the Lab.

You will be expected to play an advisory and support role for DevOps and development teams in all phases of development from architecture to delivery and also ensure the development, implementation and automation of key risk metrics and indicators to systematically measure and report on information risks in collaboration with Intact’s Global Security team.

You will keep abreast of the latest industry trends and, where appropriate, proactively propose the introduction of new security practices and technologies and participate in the IFC Security Committee.

You will also coordinate application security tests for the Product teams, interpret the results of application security tests (code scans, application intrusions, etc.) in order to inform, educate and coach the development teams with respect to application security standards, methods and development tools. 

You will manage and communicate the various security reports to the Intact Lab executives, follow up on them and put processes in place to ensure that the various security-related defects are corrected within the prescribed timeframe.

Are you eager to join a dynamic team? Do you aspire to develop your talents?  Are you comfortable sharing your knowledge with team members? If you answered yes to all these questions, we want to meet you.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits.  We anticipate that in early 2022, we’ll be moving to a hybrid approach which gives us the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays. 

#hybrid
Closing Statement

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

item.title: Manager, Application Architecture, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Your mandate:

  • Align application architecture practices with new technologies, providing migration solutions to public and internal clouds.
  • Deploy your knowledge to coach the architects in your team so that they can develop portable architectures to different clouds.
  • Influence your partners so that the proposed architectures are implemented according to the best practices of cloud native developments
  • Influence the different roadmaps to realistically integrate changes to existing systems to our target architecture


You will :

  • Develop your team to be engaged and productive while promoting the development of personal and technical skills, as well as collaboration
  • Develop the application architecture and related best practices for all digital lab applications (mobile, web and backend)
  • Collaborate with other managers to ensure that all initiatives have the right people, balancing the needs of the business with each person\'s background and career aspirations.
  • Collaborate with the enterprise and solution architecture to ensure that application architecture decisions are aligned with the directions and vision of the business
  • Ensure our impressive work meets company standards for software engineering, architecture and quality
  • Continuously evolve development practices, tools and processes in order to increase the autonomy and efficiency of teams in collaboration with the software engineering managers of the Lab
  • See to the smooth running of the application architecture delivery and make the necessary corrections when required
  • Collaborate with the different product teams to ensure that the application architecture meets the needs of digital products
  • Master all facets of software development, understand how all the components interact and can impact the performance and quality of the products delivered
  • Communicate the technological vision to team members and ensure its governance
  • Master Agile / Scrum development and ensure that the processes and tools are well suited to it
  • Cultivate change and initiate innovation
  • Stay abreast of new technologies and question the status quo.
Qualifications

You are:

  • Bilingual
  • Passionate about creating software products.
  • Passionate about software architecture and technological innovations
  • Stimulated by challenges.
  • Creative, curious and resourceful.
  • An agent of change and challenge the status quo
  • Excellent communicator able to explain their ideas to various stakeholders.
  • Visionary with a good understanding of the IT world challenges
  • Diplomat, organized, proactive and a team player.
  • A servant leader who knows how to create an open and participatory environment
  • Comfortable working in a constantly changing technological environment.


You bring with you:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Information Technology / Software Engineering or any combination of training and equivalent experience.
  • More than 10 years of experience in the design and development of software applications.
  • Solid management experience including at least 2 years in management and coordination of senior technical people and application architects.
  • A solid experience in the delivery of products in Agile / Scrum mode in Software Engineering.
  • Strong understanding of Java, Mobile, etc., web application technologies.
  • Strong understanding of different types of software architecture (Web, service oriented, distributed, event oriented, CQRS, cloud native etc.)
  • Good knowledge of different front-end technologies (React, vue, angularJS, etc.)
  • Good knowledge of different backend frameworks (kotlyn, nodeJS, Java an asset).
  • Experience with best practices in application security.
     

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.

item.title: Product Owner, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

As a Product Owner (PO) on the Acquisition team, you are responsible for ensuring delivery of strategic value for Intact’s online quote and sales. In order to maximize the business value generated by the digital work environment, the PO will integrate and manage the needs and expectations of the various stakeholders in operational, technical and other business areas. You will be part of a small squad with the goal of creating and enhancing our Acquisition digital products to the point where our product is the best product out there, period. 

Reporting to the IT Manager, your main responsibilities are :

  • End to end ownership of deliverables within the Scrum Team 
  • Build, edit and maintain the team’s backlog, priorities and roadmap
  • Collect and integrate the needs, requirements and expectations of the stakeholders, clients and collaborators into the team’s backlog 
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define the product vision and strategy ensuring their interests are included in the release. 
  • Inspire the Scrum Team to deliver best-in-class products
  • Responsible and accountable for leading, planning and tracking all business aspects of the project, including ensuring the right product is being built in the right order and release is developed by the identified deadlines
  • Monitors performance and recommends schedule changes or resource additions 
  • Ensures business objectives and targets are met through data analytics, and feedback
  • Participate in all Scrum Ceremonies
  • Follow our competitors and the industry and keep abreast of Agile/Scrum best practices and new trends
Qualifications

  • Bachelor\'s degree in a related field
  • 3 to 8 years of experience in Product Management (Business, Functional, Information)

Specific experiences - Assets strongly considered

  • Project experience in Agile/Scrum 
  • Experience and knowledge in the insurance field
  • Mastery of JIRA & Confluence
  • Knowledge of InVision, Abstract or Miro
  • Knowledge of Adobe Omniture

Required qualities

  • Be customer oriented
  • Rigor in the quality of deliverables and in the follow-up of the files entrusted
  • Ability to learn environments and systems to be up and running quickly
  • Know how to plan and organize
  • Good problem-solving skills
  • Dynamism
  • Autonomy
  • Open minded and opened to changes
  • Communication: summarize in a clear and concise manner, know how to adapt the level of language (verbal and written) and the content of the message according to the type of business or technical worker, demonstrate skills to work with people from different backgrounds, locally or remotely, in both French and English
     

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.

item.title: Senior UX Designer - Intact Lab
item.description:
Think insurance is boring? We’re about to change your mind. At Intact Lab, insurance is fast-paced, innovative and fun (yeah, you read that right). 

Intact Lab is the digital innovation hub of the Intact Financial Corporation, one of Canada’s Best Employers. We have the spirit of a start-up with the backing of big business. So what does that mean? It means we have the funding for top-notch technology and the freedom to create Insurtech products that don\'t exist, but should. That\'s where the fun comes in. 

We work collaboratively to deliver customer-friendly digital experiences. Now we\'re looking for a talented Senior UX Designer to complement our growing Enterprise UX team. That\'s where you come in. 
About the role

We’re looking for a Senior UX Designer to join our growing team! 

As a UX Designer, you will bring a human-centered approach to our products and services. You\'re an expert facilitator, researcher, and strategist. Your quest is to demystify complex problems to conceive and help bring to life delightful digital experiences across both customer and employee journeys. 

As a member of our Enterprise UX team, you will be involved in the full co-creative design process: working with stakeholders from the earliest stages of discovery, using design-driven methods to shape the way we understand problems, develop insights, and deliver solutions. You will contribute to strategy and collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders to ensure organizational buy-in, alignment, and knowledge transfer - to elevate and transform our products and experiences. 

Workplace: Toronto (700, University Ave) or Montreal (2020, Robert- Bourassa Blvd). 

What you\'ll do here :

  • Inform our strategy and innovation efforts by providing insights into the needs of our customers and business - obtained through qualitative and quantitative research. 
  • Translate research insights into actionable design solution. 
  • Produce CX/UX artifacts such as wireframes, process and service blueprints and customer journeys to create a shared understanding of the experience across all lines of business. 
  • Undertake user research: client and stakeholder interviews, focus groups, usability tests, diary studies, etc. 
  • Contribute to a range of co-creation workshops to engage stakeholders and customers in designing customer-centric processes. 
  • Develop wireframes, visual elements, and reports to communicate ideas, secure stakeholder buy-in and inspire teams at all levels, from peers to executives. 
  • Develop working prototypes to test and validate solutions for refinement. 
  • Collaborate with product owners and business analysts to support the roll- out of initiatives through experimentation, testing and refinement based on learnings. 
  • Empathize with and lead stakeholders and customers as they move through the innovation journey. 
Qualifications

Everyone has a unique career journey and experience comes in many forms - this is considered a strength on our team. If you are unsure you meet all of the criteria but still feel this might be the right fit, please apply! We’d love to meet you rather than you self-select out of the process. Plus, we believe in hiring for potential, and proudly support training should you notice any skill gaps. 

What you bring to the table: 

  • At least 3 years of experience in service design, design strategy, experience design or user experience designer. 
  • Analytical, curious and creative. 
  • Proactive, comfortable working within a self-directed culture and navigating ambiguity. 
  • A patient listener, effective communicator, engaging presenter and compelling storyteller. 
  • Comfortable with interacting at different levels in the organization, from peers to senior management. 
  • Many examples in your back pocket that showcase your process in delivering user-centered design solutions. 
  • Experience in usability, user-centered design and design thinking practices. · Experience in facilitation, design research, and strategy. 
  • A team player who thrives in a collaborative environment and can provide and receive constructive feedback. 
  • Experience with design tools (Figma, Sketch, Axure, InVision, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.) 

Nice-to-have:

  • Strong visualization skills to communicate design ideas. 
  • Bilingualism (English/French) 

​Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office. 
Closing Statement

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians.

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?
About the role

Our teams design and develop new technologies and products that are changing the way thousands of people interact with insurance. We are looking for software developers who can bring innovative ideas in all areas (Web, Mobile, AI, CI / CD, microservices, Cloud Computing, DevOps). 

You will work on a product intended to enhance the experiences of our users by offering essential self-service features through our Customer Center product.

  • Solve complex problems and challenges.

  • Knowledge of CSS and Agular.

item.title: Senior Software Developer, AI Projects – Hong Kong – Intact Lab
item.description:
Are you a developer who is passionate about AI and takes pride in writing beautiful code?  We want to meet you!

Our Intact Lab in Hong Kong is looking for an experienced Senior Software Developer to join the AI Engineering team. 

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our latest lab is located in the Hong Kong Science and Technology Park to turn this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI.
About the role

As a tech pioneer in a new AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Build high performing and scalable data analytics pipeline for real-life customer and business issues
  • Write well-designed, efficient code that can be tested, and tested, and tested
  • Influence the AI roadmap for the largest home, auto business insurer in Canada
  • Explore and master new technologies to use them in your own solutions
  • Grow alongside a diverse team of world-class experts in data science, software engineering, actuarial science, business and design
  • Mentor and coach interns and other developers to help us grow, as a team

All this plus great work-life balance, ergonomic office set-up, and our coffee & snack corner!
Qualifications

Here’s what you bring to the table:

  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, AI or a related discipline
  • 5+ years of experience in software development 
  • Proficiency with Python or other language such as Java, C++, C#, etc.
  • Experience with our tech stack: Flask, MongoDB, Kafka, ElasticSearch
  • Ability to coach other on topics such as software engineering practices such as design patterns, knowledge of the development cycle and other tools such as Git…
  • Unlimited curiosity and a passion to challenge the status quo
  • Ability to focus on vaguely defined issues requiring the application of a creative approach
  • Strong communication, time management and work organization skills
  • If you don’t have experience in AI, a strong desire to immerse yourself in this exciting field

Some nice-to-haves:

  • Big data or ML/AI experiences
  • Knowledge of DevOps modern tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, ELK;
  • Knowledge of the development technologies such as MongoDB, Kafka,
  • Experience developing data and machine learning pipelines
     
Closing Statement

Life in the Lab

Technology is only as good as the people behind it. Every day at work, you’ll inspire and be inspired by the brilliant minds of our greater lab team: actuaries, data scientists, machine learning experts, geomathematicians, meteorologists, software engineers and designers.

As our company grows, your career will grow with it.  There will always be an opportunity for you to develop your leadership skills, strengthen your expertise or take your work in a new direction.  Whether it’s moving into a new, exciting project or taking a leadership role in either managerial or technical path, your career will always be on the move.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard. 

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs. 

Background Checks

As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us.  We want Intact to be a great place to work!  This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.

About Us

The Intact Lab – with headquarters in Montreal, Canada – is a fast-growing, digital innovation hub backed by Intact Financial Corporation (TSX: IFC, HK$110 billion in market cap), Canada’s largest home, auto and business insurance company. 
Intact Financial (HK) limited (Intact Lab, HK) is our first R&D A.I. centre outside of Canada. This expansion into the Asia Pacific region is an exciting chapter of our journey to become the best insurance A.I. shop in the world.

item.title: Senior Machine Learning Software Developer, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day.

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Calling all AI and machine learning experts! We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Senior Machine Learning Software Developer to join our team.

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our lab turns this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI.

As a tech pioneer within an AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Use machine learning and advanced statistics to help build innovative solutions for real-life customer and business problems
  • Develop and deploy to production data and machine learning pipeline at scale
  • Influence the AI roadmap for the largest home, auto business insurer in Canada
  • Explore new technologies and use them in your own solutions
  • Validate the analytical approach and project outputs of other team members
  • Grow alongside a diverse team of world-class experts in data science, software engineering, actuarial science, business and design
  • Mentor and coach interns and other engineers to help us grow, as a team

All this plus great work-life balance!
Qualifications

  • A bachelor’s degree in a discipline such as computer science, software engineering, AI, or a related field. MSc is an asset
  • Significant experience of at least 5 years in software development
  • 3+ years of experience solving business problem using machine learning
  • Expertise in programming in languages such as Python and machine learning libraries such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.
  • Expertise with the machine learning development lifecycle
  • Experience developing data and machine learning pipelines
  • Familiar with the underlying theory of machine learning (supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning)
  • Unlimited curiosity and the desire to challenge the status quo
  • You can take a vaguely defined issue and bring it to life using a creative approach
  • Strong communication, time management and work organization skills
  • The passion for developing world-class data products

Some nice-to-haves:

  • Knowledge of DevOps modern tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, ELK;
  • Knowledge of our tech stack: xgboost, LightGBM, Flask, MongoDB, Kafka

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle
Closing Statement

Flexible Work Arrangements

Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits.  We anticipate that in November, we’ll be moving to a hybrid approach which gives us the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays. 

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard. 

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs. 

Background Checks

As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us.  We want Intact to be a great place to work!  This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.

Internal Candidates

For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.

Eligibility to Work in Canada

It’s important that you are legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made.  You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.
Referral Bonus

This role is eligible for employee referral bonus. #myReferrals3000

item.title: Senior AI Developer, Intact lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Your mission within our Innovation Lab :

  • Participate in the design, development and evolution of microservices, APIs and reusable libraries for the execution of our algorithms in mission critical production environments.
  • Participate in the technological watch and definition of development standards to ensure system efficiency, resilience, and sustainability.
  • Optimize the platform for maximum velocity and scalability.
  • Optimize and prioritize development tasks in collaboration with the team.
  • Help our testers in setting up component and integration tests.
  • Ensure the high level of quality of the work delivered.
  • Strengthen the development team productivity.
  • Oversee the development of appropriate tactics to achieve objectives.
  • Support and be proactively involved in problem situations or issues.
  • Play a Technical Leader / Mentor role for Squad members.
     
Qualifications

What you bring to the table :

  • Bachelor’s in computer engineering, computer science or software engineering, with a minimum of 5 years of significant experience in development of enterprise grade software solutions
  • Proficient in python language and a good understanding of programming languages such as Java and Bash
  • Good understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithm design techniques 
  • Experienced with machine learning libraries and scientific calculation such as Scikit-learn, NumPy, SciPy, etc.
  • Experienced with software engineering life cycle and agile methodologies.
  • Experienced in developing complex services based on Docker, Kubernetes, Flask and Spring Boot
  • Experienced with modern DevOps tools such as Gitlab, Grafana, ELK stack, Jenkins
  • Working knowledge of streaming and batch processing systems such as Kafka.
  • Familiarity with machine learning and data processing frameworks such as XGBoost, Tensorflow or Spark.
  • Familiarity with data storage and warehousing technologies such as Snowflake, MongoDB, S3.
  • Familiarity with AWS technologies such as Kinesis, Lambda and CloudWatch is a plus.
     

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team : 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.

item.title: Application Architect, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Intact is the largest P&C insurance provider in Canada with unparalleled market share in the industry. We insure more than 5 million individuals and businesses coast to coast and employ approximately 11,500 people. We believe insurance should focus on people, not things. That\'s why we work very hard to provide our customers with an unparalleled experience and maintain our digital leadership. 

Technology is therefore an essential component of our success and our software engineering team of 3,000 employees is actively working on vast transformation programs and several innovative digital projects.Are you passionate about building and delivering software products? Do you want to have an impact and contribute to the success of our digital strategies? Do you like working with cutting-edge technologies, are you stimulated by challenges and have a proven experience in software engineering architecture? Come join our team. We are currently looking for an Application Architect for Intact Lab who will play a critical role in supporting our growth.
 

What you’ll do here:

As an Application Architect you will have the chance to participate in the creation and modernization of our current and future applications. You will help build and improve our development practice from all angles by taking part in and leading the Lab\'s development community of practice. You will have the opportunity to demonstrate that your ideas work by performing POCs and testing your solutions. 

Your main responsibilities will be to define the best software architectures for our web applications that are used by over 2 million Canadians. You will be expected to use your skills and talents to implement these solutions using industry best practices while keeping the security of our applications in mind. To do this, you will help implement both functional and non-functional requirements.

Your playing field will be complex but will allow you to grow in your practice with access to ongoing training in new technologies. You will collaborate and support the very talented developers in the Lab as well as the solution architects who will help you build end-to-end solutions to meet Intact\'s ambitious goals.

 

  • Carry out a permanent technological watch
  • Lead the development of the technology roadmap with the practice of technical leadership
  • Ensure consistency with the technological vision and the architectural quality of the lab\'s products.
  • Ensure compliance with the design and development rules imposed
  • Collaborate with other architects in the Lab and the company to define and implement best software engineering practices
  • Define and document the architecture of the applications, jointly with the technical leader of the product and taking into account the constraints of the projects.
  • Act as a mentor and technical lead with software engineering teams
Qualifications

What you bring to the table:

  • A software craftsman driven by challenges
  • A change agent who doesn\'t hesitate to challenge the status quo, especially in these times of migration to public clouds
  • An excellent popularizer capable of explaining his ideas to various stakeholders
  • Organized, proactive and a driver of change
  • Comfortable working and promoting an ever-changing technological environment
  • A leader and excellent team player ready to dive back into the code to help his team
  • A technical mentor, very active in terms of technological monitoring and ready to share his knowledge in a concrete way through functional proofs of concept
  • At ease with the development of architectural designs including both front-end web components and back-end services.
  • Bilingual

You have :

  • Bachelor\'s degree in information technology/software engineering or any combination of education and equivalent experience.
  • Proven technical leadership and architectural experience in software development.
  • 5+ years of experience designing and delivering distributed systems and applications
  • Good knowledge of application security, its mechanisms and OWASP standards.
  • Prior experience in agile development, continuous delivery and DevOps culture.
  • Excellent knowledge of Software and Enterprise Design Patterns.
  • An excellent knowledge of Spring.
  • Good knowledge of containers and orchestrators such as Kubernetes, EKS, AKS, etc.
  • Excellent knowledge of Object Oriented.
  • A good knowledge of Reactive Programming, Event driven architecture
  • A good knowledge of one of the following front end technologies: React, Angular.
  • Experience with RESTful projects using JWT, OAuth 2.0.
  • Excellent knowledge of RESTFul standards and the OpenAPI specification,
  • Good working knowledge of the I.D.E.A.L.S principle and the 12 factor app method
  • Concrete experience in automated cloud service creation as well as automated application delivery
  • Good knowledge of cloud technologies and development and architecture best practices to deliver on different public clouds
     

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.
