item.title: Full Stack Software Developer
item.description:
Description

 

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.
 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Reliability Data Engineering and Analytics Team at TELUS focusses on instantaneous detection of events that could lead to incidents, outages and negatively impact the customer experience.

 

As a Full Stack Software Developer, your innovative mindset, technical skills, and passion for growth will be critical in continuing to grow our data analytics practices for predictive insights and early detection of incidents. Be a part of the team that uses cutting edge technology to implement machine learning and predictive analytics which will shape tomorrow\'s AI Ops. 

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Collaborating with other designers, engineers and DevOps team members
  • Creating beautiful and fast code that improves our code base in meaningful ways
  • Using test-driven development to write well-tested codes
  • Fixing bugs fast and solving hard problems well
  • Curiosity and passion to constantly learn new things

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • University Degree/Diploma in Computer Science or Engineering
  • 2 years’ experience using GCP cloud monitoring and logging
  • 1 year hands on experience with Looker development
  • At least 1+ years’ experience working with Big Query
  • At least 1+ years’ experience with CI/CD pipeline, can create Terraform scripts
  • Knowledge/experience working with Linux (Red Hat Enterprise/CentOS) and Windows, in a DevOps environment and Splunk
  • Knowledge of Agile, Test-Driven Development and Continuous Deployment

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Relational databases and SQL
  • Networking protocols
  • SDN technologies, virtualization environment and Docker containers
  • NiFi flow development
  • Redshift/ Snowflake

item.title: Solution Architect
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.

 

Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.
 

What you’ll do     

 

  • Collaborate with both technology and business partners and domain architects in order to design robust enterprise grade solutions
  • Document various solution options and recommend the best approach balancing constraints and future needs
  • Propose solutions to enable business objectives while advancing enterprise tech strategies
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models
  • Participate in requirements review sessions or attend intake assessment meetings to estimate effort for high-level solutions
     

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for your 10+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You have an architecture level understanding of APIs, security architecture, and cloud native development on one of the major cloud providers (GCP, Azure, AWS)
  • You have experience with designing, developing, and operationalizing high-volume back-end web applications
  • You have experience with REST API design
  • You have strong proficiency with JavaScript and understand the nature of asynchronous programming

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • GCP experience and certification
  • Experienced in working with NodeJS

item.title: Manager-Technology Strategy - Wireless Core Network and Services DevOps
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

TELUS’ Wireless Core Network & Services Dev/Ops team is responsible architecture, deployment, optimization, and operations for technology platforms that support the national wireless core network. We have a unique opportunity for an engaging people leader to manage a software development team.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You will lead a team of engineers and software developers to transform to virtualized network functions, softwarize network services, and improve service reliability across core platforms. The team will work with our industry partners, both telco vendors and hyperscalers, to develop and operate wireless services including but not limited to system integration, software development, data analytics and automation. Your management skills, industry knowledge and technological leadership will shape TELUS’ next-generation networks and services.  Moreover, your natural abilities to collaborate with other teams such as Product and Sales will set you apart.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Coach, develop and inspire a diverse team of DevOps professionals
  • Solve problems and handle escalation in a collaborative and effective manner 
  • Set key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure individual and team successes
  • Build trust and partnership with internal/external stakeholders and lead customers
  • Develop and operate software solutions based on virtualized infrastructure and 5G 
  • Focus on reliability across critical user journeys
  • Using Agile engineering principles, you will lead the efforts to quickly adapt to new technologies, services and applications
  • With a constant focus on customer experience and industry trends, you will lead on-going improvements to our core to ensure the best customer experience every time, everywhere
  • Manage platform lifecycles, 3-year service roadmap and Capex/Opex budgets
  • Adopt principals of Reliability by Design, Security by Design and Privacy by Design

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Respected as a collaborative partner and trusted advisor who builds strong relationships across the organization and providing value add
  • Regarded as an excellent communicator, negotiator and influencer, able to communicate complex ideas and concepts to a variety of audiences including senior leaders in a clear, simple, easy to understand manner
  • Recognized for your Customer First mindset and delivering on optimal outcomes for both internal and external stakeholders
  • Sought out for your strategic thinking, business acumen, sound decision making and result-driven mindset with the ability to take initiative and ownership of complex issues through to resolution
  • Solid knowledge and understanding of:
    • Application integration models and methodologies
    • Agile development and DevOps methodologies
    • Application Development environments and technologies for delivering digital solutions
    • Software development and coding techniques 
    • Cloud native technologies and concepts
  • Proven business, financial and strategic skills with experience in assessing alternatives and business case development
  • Noted to have a high degree of curiosity, continuously learning new topics, concepts and technologies, and also looking beyond the surface level to understand the full picture and questioning/challenge the status-quo resulting to drive higher business value
  • Respected for your advanced knowledge of 3GPP (IMS/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) wireless core networks optimization and performance
  • Ability to interact with technical team members and distill complex ambiguous problems into actionable items
  • Experience negotiating with vendors for new technology and support agreements
  • Broad base of knowledge across IT and Network systems, support and processes
  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and/or relevant experience

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Big data correlation and machine learning knowledge
  • Experience in web/mobile applications development
  • Master of Engineering degree and/or MBA

item.title: Design Specialist (Cloud RAN Automation Technology and Performance)
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The latest Open RAN (Radio Access Network) technology brings not only BBU (baseband unit) cloudifications & virtualization, open interfaces between DU (Distributed Unit) and RU(Radio Unit) , but also introduces and enables ORAN intelligent automation platform namely SMO (Service Management and Orchestration) with RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) which applies automation at scale to simplify the complexity of ORAN networks, as well as improve network performance, enhance customer experience and minimize ORAN operational costs with ORAN analytics and assurance. 

 

TELUS is forming a new Cloud RAN automation platform DevOps team which will oversee the development, operations and evolution of ORAN SMO and RIC architecture and technology. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth. We see great value in bringing Cloud, IP/MPLS, data analytics and software development professionals into this team in addition to RAN knowledge to not only develop these platforms but also enhance the systems to enable TELUS ORAN intelligent operations by closely working with TELUS Stakeholders, vendors and ORAN DevOps team.

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Be responsible for ORAN SMO (service management and orchestration) platform design and technology development, drive vendor’s SMO roadmap to align with TELUS’s ORAN automation strategies
  • Be responsible for ORAN RIC (RAN Intelligent Controller) platform design and technology development
  • Create ORAN automation policies & rules, templates & algorithms and workflow services for ORAN full stack automation, including vRAN Bare Metal, xHaul, CaaS, and vDU/vCU services. 
  • Develop O-Cloud (ORAN-Cloud) orchestration and federation solutions including ORAN IMS (Infrastructure Management Services) and DMS (Deployment management Services)
  • Responsible for ORAN Software and Hardware Life Cycle Management solution development and introduction
  • Lead the development of ORAN data processing workflow, as well as data pipelines system design and configurations to ensure data availability and integrity to end users
  • Define TELUS RIC model and algorithm standards for new xApp and rApp onboarding
  • Lead the integration with TELUS overarching remedy’s and systems
  • Drive Open SMO integration with TELUS’s selected vRAN solutions
  • Technology introduction of evolutionary ORAN OAM (FCAPS) via streaming telemetry
  • Lead SMO/RIC platform AI (Artificial Intelligent)/ML (Machine Learning) workflow services design and technology introduction

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • 5+ years of working experience on IP/MPLS and Kubernetes networking, familiar with associated protocols (VxLAN, Calico, CNI, M-LAG, EVPN etc.)
  • Experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) technology
  • Expertise in one or more programming languages and data formats such as Java, Python, GO, XML, YAML, Shell Scripting, JSON, Restful APIs etc. 
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Experience on Kubernete cloud analytics tools (i.e beats, logstash, elasticsearch, kibana, Kafka and/or Prometheus)
  • Experience on large scale Kubernetes cluster orchestration and federation solutions and tools, familiar with Windriver central cloud and conductor, or Openshift ACM, or Robin MDCAP is a big asset for successful candidate 
  • Creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • Proactive, can lead cross-team initiatives
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

 

  • Experience in Requirements Engineering, Solution Architecture, Design, Development and Deployment Experience in Underlying infrastructure for Big Data Solutions (Clustered/Distributed Computing, Storage, Data Center Networking) 
  • Familiar with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi- or Hybrid-cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Big Query, DataFlow etc.
  • Experience with AI/ML toolkits such as Tensor Flow, Mllib, H2Oai , Kubeflow etc

ORANJobs  *LI-hybrid *LI-remote

item.title: Splunk/New Relic Developer
item.description:
Description


Join our team

 

With the convergence of innovative home and mobile networking technologies including fiber and 5G, smart home solutions, mobile devices, automation, cloud computing and over-the-top capabilities, our customers’ homes look very different in today’s digital world. Every day, TELUS’ engineering and development teams are envisioning what the future holds and building the technologies to simplify our customers’ lives, provide services at the touch of a button and create immersive entertainment experiences. ffhjobs

 

We are the Future Friendly Home Services DevOps group, and we are looking for Splunk/New Relic developers to join our team! We are responsible for the end-to-end technology development and operations of TELUS’ Optik TV services, video and over-the-top services, broadband network capabilities, smart home solutions and software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) solutions. As a Splunk/New Relic developer, you will help us drive a large scale digital transformation program. It’s an exciting time to be a part of our mission to drive better outcomes through customer-centric, state-of-the-art software platforms.


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

  • Contribute to an inclusive, knowledgeable and highly motivated team, using SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) practices to frequently deliver valuable software to market
  • Unlock the power of cloud-native environments, having the freedom to leverage innovative technologies and the latest standards
  • Help drive a high-performance DevOps culture
  • Become a go-to expert on the code components you are responsible for and how they fit into the overall architecture, promoting a seamless solution
  • Power future possibilities for our customers and advance a compelling portfolio of technologies and services from consumer front ends, to streaming and content protection, to user entitlements and payments

 
Here\'s how

 

  • Provide day to day support for Splunk/New Relic environments and full system life cycle
  • Extensive working experience in creating and implementing dashboards
  • Analyze highly complex business requirements; generate technical specifications to design or redesign complex software components and applications
  • Act as a technical resource expert for modeling, simulation, and analysis efforts
  • Leverage industry best practices to design, test, implement and support the solution
  • Act as the Splunk/New Relic subject matter expert in providing technical leadership in the design, development and support, and other intelligence big data analytics industry initiatives
  • Use your experience to explore a variety of machine learning, statistical analytics, and data mining techniques to improve Corporate Security’s investigative capabilities using technology to support monitoring and digital fraud investigation needs
     

 

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience and extensive working knowledge, training and/or certifications in Splunk Enterprise (installing, configuring, troubleshooting different Splunk components and building clusters; integrating with external services; CI/CD deployment of elements and dashboards)
  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience and extensive working knowledge of New Relic (installing agents, configuring, troubleshooting different New Relic components; configuring API keys, integrating with external services; CI/CD deployment of elements and dashboards)
  • Extensive experience troubleshooting multi-layer frontend/backend systems.
  • Proficiency in Python, SPL language, XML, HTML, CSS, JSON, Excel
  • Solid understanding of SQL scripting for querying databases (MySQL, Postgresql, Cassandra, etc.)
  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience with Linux
  • 3 or more years of hands-on experience with Cloud technologies – GCP, AWS, or Azure
  • Deep knowledge of Kubernetes and underlying technologies
  • Must be self-motivated, energetic, and results-oriented and be committed to adding value to the organization
  • Highly flexible and able to adapt quickly to changing priorities

 

Great to Have

 

  • Bachelor\'s degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.
  • Deep knowledge of proxying and load balancing technologies such as HAProxy or NGINX
  • Experience in agile development practices including the ability to create CI/CD pipelines from scratch using tools such as: Jenkins, Gitlab and Github
  • Experience building positive relationships and collaborating with a variety of diverse groups and technical teams and able to translate technical concepts into easy-to-understand business language
  • A creative approach to problem solving and the ability to work independently to manage deliverables in an environment with high levels of ambiguity

item.title: Senior Strategy Manager
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together


This is a dream job for the curious, analytical mind wanting to push the boundaries and challenge the status quo. You will be professionally rewarded by the diversity of problems and data sets, and with your expertise, provide discoveries that will solve complex challenges and opportunities that drive strategic business decisions to delivering optimum business outcomes, including capital deployment plans, and exceptional customers experiences. Additionally, you will develop appropriate data models and frameworks, drawing from various data sources, to support business investments and improved MCE reliability.

 

Our team will formulate and facilitate strategies backed by data. You will use your past experiences to find data, analyze it for trends that support both short term tactics in support of strategies that may take years to achieve.

 

What you’ll do 


Reporting to the Director, Planning & Engineering with the Mission Critical Environments (MCE) team, you are responsible for leading the development and execution of MCE business and transformational programs, driving exemplary client experience and unit cost improvements.

 

You are a dynamic self-starter and thought leader with top-notch people skills and an analytical edge. You will create a consolidated business unit strategy across the MCE planning, operations, and build teams and lead the evolution / execution of multiple, high-priority business unit strategies and programs that will include executive updates via business case and presentations. You are MCE’s lead within the Reliability Leadership Team (RLT) delivering priority and reliability based capital funding requests.

 

You will develop the business unit and MCE capital strategy by:

 

  • Soliciting and consolidate inputs from various stakeholder teams to support the development of the MCE strategic plan, selected business planning roadmaps and issues and opportunities for improvement
  • Establish performance indicators that measure (metrics/KPIs) program success:
    • Develop, maintain and manage appropriate Scorecard (as a measure of success), including working with other relevant resources (x-functional SMEs, ops stakeholders) to define “success” for MCE programs, projects and initiatives
    • Ensure Scorecard Objectives are met – on time, on budget, in scope
    • Provide Executive level reporting
  • Building sound analytics and processes to support the improved understanding of all equipment failure rates and replacement options, including drawing conclusions and recommending proposals resulting from analysis
  • Solving diverse business problems in a data rich environment through data mining, predictive modeling, machine learning, statistics and other analytical techniques
  • Visualizing and reporting data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provides insights that will drive strategic business decisions
  • Supporting the development of the annual Strategy Check presentation and support of all yearly planning cycles
  • Lead multiple, large programs and support a high-performance, highly engaged cross-functional team responsible for executing on key cross-functional initiatives
  • Drive program execution against strategic, operational and financial objectives; own and deliver key tenants of MCE financial budget targets
  • Working within an agile/scrum environment
  • Fostering internal as well as external Partner and Client executive relationships

 

 

Qualification

 

What you bring

 

  • University degree (preferably in Engineering or Diploma in Engineering or Electronics plus experience in Statistic modeling)
  • 5 or more years of experience with data analytics experience covering large data volumes and complex data sets from varying sources
  • 5 or more years of experience within Network or IT operations
  • Knowledge or experience in strategic planning, business analysis and/or business systems analysis
  • Project management methodologies, principles and practices
  • Understanding of business drivers, customers and the links to IT strategies & priorities
  • Understanding of performance metrics development & analysis, process improvement or portfolio management
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to simplify the explanation of complex business challenges
  • Collaboration across all levels of the MCE team and with key stakeholders

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Six Sigma – green belt

item.title: Manager, Market Intelligence - Mobility Solutions Campaign Measurements & Insights
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team of influencers as we use data to drive better business outcomes!  #Li-remote 

 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

Join the Campaign Management and Data Science leadership team. This team plays a pivotal role in delivering personalized, contextual and automated end-to-end customer marketing lifecycle touchpoints across the Mobility Solutions base to deliver optimal customer experiences while maximizing financial outcomes. We are seeking an individual with dynamic leadership skills - combined with a passion for campaign marketing, data strategy and analytics to lead the Campaign Measurements and Insights team.

 

What you’ll do

 

You will lead a team of five amazing team members who manage campaign performance across various Mobility Solutions portfolios. Together, you will identify opportunities to influence campaign strategy, prioritization and optimize how we execute. You’ll flex your communication and interpersonal skills to work with various team members to drive insights and:

 

  • Collaborate with multiple teams including Customer Base Management, Database Marketing, Home Solutions, Data Science, and Business Intelligence teams, to design campaigns, how we measure, prioritize and evolve campaigns
  • Lead and nurture the transformation to enable data-driven decision-making across campaign management portfolios, utilizing strong interpersonal skills to identify and resolve key areas where change management is required
  • Provide coaching and mentoring support to a highly skilled team, ensuring that we maintain a high-performing, highly engaged collaborative culture

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • You are a people-first leader with the ability to coach, develop and grow high-performing teams
  • You foster collaboration and strong relationships across a diverse stakeholder community
  • You have a knack for interpreting strategy and understanding how it impacts result
  • You have foundational and management knowledge and experience of SAS and Oracle and an ability to manipulate data using Excel and SQL
  • You are comfortable working in a dynamic, ambiguous environment with a roll up your sleeves attitude
  • You have a strong business acumen and a bias for action to support the teams in negotiating priority and resources to deliver on expected outcomes and commitments
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing blocks to get to outcomes
  • You are curious and don’t settle for the status quo

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Knowledge of GCP, Python, Tableau, Domo
  • Strong analytical and technical skills including quantitative analysis, programming and strategy integration

 

Above all else, attitude, motivation, and a willingness to learn and collaborate are the most important things we are looking for. So if you think you have what it takes, please apply!

item.title: Senior Front End Developer - API Marketplace Portal
item.description:
Join our team


Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading-edge technologies. We hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s Top 100 Employer (2022) with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, and award-winning opportunities for career development.
 
The API Marketplace gives the ability to connect API consumers with API owners, enabling the creation of thousands of applications by TELUS teams and 3rd parties. Being able to support a broad range of applications from customer self-care to health to messaging to emergency response to fleet management to charitable giving and beyond, the API Marketplace plays a foundational role for TELUS to participate in the digital economy.

 
What you\'ll do
 

As a Senior React Developer, you will help drive the software development for our core network infrastructure and services. Your creativity coupled with strong software development, automation, data science, and computer networking skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building and maintaining our API gateway platform to a variety of types of services from network capabilities to health services to support existing mobility infrastructure and offer new services.
 
You will exercise your entrepreneurial spirit and creative vision to change the way TELUS leverages technology. Collectively, the passion we have to transform the Network landscape will remain a leading factor in why customers continue to recognize TELUS as the fastest and most reliable network in Canada.

 
Here’s how
 

  • Create new solutions while working as part of our existing Agile Development Team with a good focus on quality, automated testing and reliability
  • Develop quality solutions through adherence to coding standards and test automation.
  • Develop new features and implement design improvements 
  • Participate in creation of technical design documentation: Detail design & architecture documents
  • Participate in operational improvement initiatives, in conjunction with other technology teams in the company

What you bring

 

  • With a Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Valued for your 5+ years of relevant professional experience as a Senior React Developer with demonstrated experience guiding a team 
  • Skilled in software development/software engineering, process automation using programming/scripting languages
  • Working in collaborative agile development teams, with experience working with CI/CD pipelines and activities.
  • Known for your experience working on cloud computing platforms including AWS & GCP
  • Passionate about API design
  • Committed to building strong relationships with key stakeholders including senior management across the technology and partnering organizations


Great-to-haves
 

  • Java Experience
  • DevOps tools such as Ansible, Jenkins, GitLAB and Splunk


Note:  Can work remotely from any major Canadian city

item.title: Technical Product Manager
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

Our mission is to make life easier for our partners, our customers, and for our team. We’re looking for a Technical Product Owner to join our high-performing customer-centric wireless, IoT and TELUS Pay team. Our team is responsible for growing and managing wholesale wireless and IoT portfolios. We work with other large and small telecom companies and digital payment aggregators in providing best in class products and services.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

In this role, you will set the direction for our End-to-End partner and customer journey as part of the product/service development. You will own, help with the vision, strategic direction and roadmap for all digital asset development supporting our products. Working closely with partners across the organization, you’ll chart the path, deliver impact for customers, and launch new products.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Working closely with the product team you will define a shared vision on the platforms and processes supporting our products 
  • Be a champion for vision and prioritization of digital experiences in partnership with partners to achieve the business outcomes (return on investment)
  • You will bring your technician knowledge to drive conversations with our technical teamWork with project managers and financial analysts to prepare a annual financial capital investment plan to win support in getting your programs funded
  • Establish relationships and liaise with a diverse group of cross-functional partners within the organization; collaborate on interdependent roadmaps and technology investments to achieve mutual business outcomes
  • Build organizational support and the understanding of the strategic direction of the product
  • Define tangible product roadmap - actively own and be responsible for the product backlog and prioritize based on feedback and value
  • Accountable for critical product metrics and to report progress, provide ongoing communication to partners on progress
  • Balance expectations and remove business and roadmap impediments
  • Own product research and measurements, drive optimizations
  • Accountable for the overall product health (security, accessibility, performance and more)

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • Has 2-5 years of experience working on complex multi-year digital products with agile delivery
  • Theorizing ideas for process improvement and implements the change
  • Shows good ability to use 1 or more planning tools, e.g. JIRA
  • Has the ability to track time and cost against an agreed baseline and provide an early warning of likely deviation
  • Responsible for ensuring projects are delivered to budget and schedule
  • Noted for your expertise as a Product Owner in a digital team or company, including hands-on experience managing all stages of the product life cycle
  • With a strong foundation in and knowledge of Agile process and principles
  • Known for your ability to work in a highly-collaborative, cross-functional setting, with an ability to co-create, execute, and foster trusted relationships with other teams to deliver customer value 

 
Great-to-haves

 

  • Knowledge of wireless network, architecture, 5G, IoT considered a strong asset
  • Building ECommerce experiences and experience with digital payments
  • Bachelor\'s degree in Information Technology (computer science, data sciences, or equivalent experience)
  • Previous technical experience or software development experience 
  • Working directly with the Product Engineering team including outsourcing partners
  • Basic understanding of cloud and local APIs, interface agreements, etc

item.title: Cloud Data Architect
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Enterprise Data Layer team designs, implements and oversees the GCP analytics platform at TELUS.  Known as the DataHub, our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the organization with modern cloud native services, DataOps methodologies and processes, and a self-serve data environment to test & learn and productionalize data models enabling data driven decisions.  Our vision is to empower our TELUS business partners with a standardized platform utilizing infrastructure, policy and governance as code, setting guide rails for teams to develop their data & analytics use cases within our cloud data platform.

We are looking for technical enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solution.
Together we will build and enable best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.
 
Enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Use your analytical skills and ability to assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.


What you’ll do

 

  • Work with and listen to business and technical teams to understand their needs
  • Define the ideal cloud data architecture with a focus on self-serve, efficiency, security and privacy
  • Design and implement solutions that move us forward on our MLOPs, DevOps and infrastructure as code journey within GCP
  • Collaborate kindly and proactively with the rest of our team and our customers (internal teams at TELUS)
  • Implement best in class cloud architecture to solve business use cases from concept to production
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Provision and maintain existing platforms to facilitate growth and stability
  • Author quality documentation for any solutions implemented on both how they were implemented and how to use them

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are collaborative and able to work with various IT and business teams to deliver on outcomes 
  • You are able to share a vision and implement long-term data strategies while providing value early and often along the journey
  • You have in depth knowledge of data architecture both on premise and on GCP, AWS and / or Azure platforms and have demonstrated experience designing and implementing enterprise grade data environments
  • You have experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Terraform, Kubernetes, Composer and serverless computing
  • You have in depth experience with the flow of data between systems, cloud big data environments and tooling with applications such as BigQuery, Dataflow, BigTable, Data Catalog, CloudSQL, Vertex AI, Pub/Sub, Dataprep and Cloud Spanner
  • You can design and deploy distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You have experience with YAML and/or JSON for configuration
  • You can explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces, and APIs to senior leaders and business stakeholders
  • You understand that system stability drives availability and customer trust
  • You have demonstrated experience with Secure by Design and Zero Trust data architectures and are able to provision cloud infrastructure with best in class security
  • You have in depth knowledge of PII and privacy compliance and have demonstrated architectural design, system interactions and life cycle management that puts customer safety first
  • You are able to provide guidance to optimize data collection, storage, and consumption by choosing the right platforms and tools for the right use casesYou have good understanding of DevOps & DataOps principles and tools

 

Great-to-haves

 

 

  • Experience with Google’s BigQuery service
  • Experience with MLOPs methodologies and process
  • Data Warehousing and data modeling design experience
  • Experience with FinOps and Cloud platform budget management

item.title: Senior Design Specialist - 5G Capacity and Data Analytics
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

Join a team that is in the heart of the telecommunications revolution. Help us transform our network capacity planning processes to enter the 5G era.

 

Our team is responsible for the capacity planning of TELUS’ wireless network, this includes a broad range of data analytics and engineering activities, from projects that guide multi-year executive strategies to day-to-day network capacity planning to support the growing network traffic. You will have the opportunity not only to master new technologies, but also apply modern engineering best practices, including automation and ML/AI, to build and evolve the Best Wireless Network.

 

As a 5G Capacity and Data Analytics Specialist, you’ll provide technical leadership to ensure we efficiently plan and deploy network capacity based on customer specific requirements. The role is an intersection between Network Performance, Business Requirements and Customer Experience.

 

Your creativity coupled with strong data analytics skills and RF Engineering will allow us to find the best ways of building our wireless 4G/5G networks to support existing and new services. Finally, together as a team, we will help shape the future vision of TELUS’ wireless network by providing important guidance to executives on how best to address our evolving business challenges.

What you’ll do

 

  • By using modern data analytics and automation techniques, transform our capacity planning processes to enter the 5G service based era
  • By proactively defining novel capacity planning techniques/models for 5G/LTE use cases
  • By producing and managing the RAN network capacity plans for mobility and fixed wireless users
  • By collaborating with other technical and business teams to understand new technologies and services to make our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
  • By developing dashboards and data visualizations, you will provide insights into network capacity that can be shared with executives and peer groups
  • By monitoring network performance, you will identify actual capacity problems and predict future congestion issues in the network
  • By leading the implementation of wireless capacity augments, you will build working processes with performance and construction teams to drive improvements in customer experience

 

What you bring

 

  • Bachelor\'s degree in computer science, computer engineering or engineering
  • 7+ years of experience in mobile capacity planning and radio network design or optimization, and expertise in 5G and LTE technologies
  • Three to five years of experience in data analysis or software development
  • Proven ability to operate independently from general guidelines
  • Ability to refine (locally) or expand (nationally) analyzes based on a specific problem Ability to problem solve and make intuitive decisions using large data sets
  • Passion for data science, forecasting and using data visualization platforms like Splunk
  • Experience with SQL databases, understanding of NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB, Splunk)
  • Python experience and basic knowledge of common data analysis libraries

 

Great to haves

 

  • Master\'s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Experience with agile methodology and cloud services, preferably Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in deploying Node.js application, microservices or distributed systems

item.title: Senior Project Manager, Data Engineering
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

We are the TELUS Data Strategy & Enablement team and our mission is to drive TELUS to become a world-class data insights driven organization, delivering world-class data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data and a data-product/data platform oriented culture. Our team members are passionate, dynamic, entrepreneurial and highly engaged, driven to achieve great outcomes for our customers, our team members, our communities and our environment. We believe in continuous meaningful transformation integrating dynamic change in our professional lives. Our team members are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.
 

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Sr. Project Manager, Data Engineering. Reporting to the Director – Data Engineering Platforms, you will lead and deliver data driven technology projects in collaboration with the Data Engineering Platforms team. Our team is responsible for enabling, enriching and democratizating data for TELUS in order to support many business units across the organization drive revenue, realize cost savings & efficiencies and to improve the customer experience via the following major workstreams:

 

  • Master Data Management
  • Revenue Generating Unit Reporting
  • Usage and Revenue Reporting
  • Consumer and Business customer interactions
  • Data Lake and Oracle DB migration to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


We work with internal and external partners to develop new data products and services and provide the highest tier of support for our enterprise grade data pipelines to GCP for TELUS. We continuously strive to improve the reliability of our data and the overall GCP platform through technology innovations and the latest SRE best practices.
 

What you’ll do

  • Develop and implement roadmaps that provide a consolidated view including updates, delivery plans, compiling financial forecasts, tracking actuals, managing purchases, tracking material.
  • Work closely with technical teams on the end to end delivery of customer facing features and content.
  • Managing the overall portfolio budget (CAPEX & OPEX) by monitoring expenditures to ensure costs stay within the approved budgeted amount
  • Gathering and analyzing financial data to identify areas for improvement and to keep projects on budget and on time.
  • Manage infrastructure deployment and software development projects.
  • Partner with internal and external teams to deliver on strategic initiatives.
  • Balance day to day workload with the demands of a fast-paced Agile delivery team.
  • Facilitate and maintain relationships between organization and vendors/partners.
  • Contribute to the establishment of a common set of practices, tools and templates for portfolio, program, and project-level management and ensure standards are being followed.
     

Qualifications

What you bring

 

  • 3-5 years of technical project management experience delivering IT Projects on Time, on Budget and with Quality.
  • Familiarity with Scrum, SAFe agile frameworks to manage product delivery.
  • Experience working with product owners to identify skill-sets and ensure backlog completeness including estimates.
  • Understanding of Big Data, Data Architecture, Informatica ETL tools and Google Cloud Platform products and services.
  • Skilled in using JIRA, Confluence, Google Suite, Fieldglass and SAP.
  • Manage project schedules, partners & vendors identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders.
  • Ability to foster collaborative working relationships with internal and external teams through leadership, embracing diversity and introducing new ideas
  • Skillful in problem-solving and resolving issues creatively and always through a customer lens.
  • Innovative and out of the box thinking - you are curious and never stop learning.
  • Ability to manage key deliverables, project status reporting, excellent communication and presentation skills as part of an extended project team and committed to working with engineers, architects and product managers.
  • Demonstrated ability to learn, both complex technical concepts and end to end business processes.
  • Flexible in managing ambiguity, uncertainty and changing priorities.
  •  Bachelor\'s degree in Technology, Engineering, Business or other technical disciplines.

 

Great-to-haves

  •  PMP, Agile, CSM certifications.
  •  Project Management experience in software automation, cloud migrations, hardware deployments & data analytics.

item.title: Design Specialist II- Best Services Mobility Dev/Ops
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 


The telecommunications world is expanding and diversifying as we shift into a world of data everywhere and our customers are changing too, expecting a reliable and future-friendly communications experience.


Our team objective is to enable and support our rapidly-evolving data, telephony, messaging and emergency communications products and services for our customers in the way that makes sense to them, is easy to understand and to use.


The Voice Services and Wireless Core DevOps team works closely with cross functional teams across the organization to realize our collective Customer First vision. We learn and grow through our experiences, new technology and process evolution. We get to think, plan and prepare for the future! As experts in our fields, we’re a team who equally celebrates failure and success. We are passionate about learning, growing and developing as individuals and as a team.


The Best Services Mobility team is seeking a creative, entrepreneurial, energetic, and bright candidate to join our team.


Your mission is to make recommendations in improving our Mobility customer experience (consumer, IoT, FWA, Enterprise) based on key performance indicators. You will accomplish this by:

 

 

  • Creating a visualized service management system based on the network elements data and
  • crowdsourced user data, including
  • Monitoring the network health in real-time and the user satisfaction in level of granularities
  • Improving the existing workflow, network capacity and service quality
  • Predicting the failure, initialize self-healing and recommend proactive healing process 

 

 

What you’ll do


We’re a dynamic team, so a high degree of flexibility is required to adapt to a wide variety of tasks and functions.

 

 

  • Explore customer feedback and analytics to drive improvements in our products and services
  • Clearly see things from the perspective of a customer
  • Thrive in a lean, fast paced and changing environment
  • View collaboration as essential to your work
  • Have a passion for reliability
  • Build, maintain and leverage strong relationships with your stakeholders and maintain a collaborative model in order to ensure that you are collectively meeting the requirements of the business 

 

What you bring

 

 

  • Visible champion and spokesperson for change
  • A strong end to end ownership culture mindset towards product and end customer experience
  • Confident in your knowledge of CI/CD DevOps best practices and the tools used to implement them
  • Able to understand existing pipelines with ease and develop new ones
  • Knowledge and experience with scripting and automation, ex. Ansible, Python, Java, C#, Javascript, Go, etc.
  • Know how to architect and deploy secure and robust services/applications on private cloud using NFV infrastructure and SDN (Openstack, Openshift, Contrail)
  • Familiar with cloud principles and what makes a service cloud native
  • Hands on with database services, cloud storage, computing and networking
  • Know how to connect, evaluate, filter and transform raw data and convert to trusted data
  • Understand typical telco KPIs and QoS
  • Have passion working on huge quantity of data from multiple sources to find the trends and insights
  • Engage different department to calibrate the data insights
  • Familiar with ML training and evaluation and make use of failure prediction and load forecast
  • Able to visualize the data insights in high level and low level
  • Understand best practices for building easy to use, scalable, resilient and secure services and applications
  • Initiative, attention to details and problem-solving attitude
  • Recognized for your 5 years relevant professional work experience
  • Bachelor degree in Computer science, Engineering degree or related field

 

Great-to-haves

 

 

  • Experience working with Agile/Scrum/Kanban
  • Experience in the wireless core network, especially Evolved Packet Core (EPC - PGW, UPF) and security (Firewall/NAT)
  • Experience in architecting solutions in a cloud environment
  • Experience of large scale data analytics projects
  • Experience in public cloud environment (GCP, AWS)
  • Experience with elastic search environment (kibana, grafana)
  • Experience of mobile network and operator-grade networking
  • Experience with KPI dashboards, data visualization and data science and analytics (Tableau, Elastic Stack, Netscout, Database/SQL)
  • Scripting and/or Software Development Experience (Bash, Python, JavaScript)
  • Passionate about working with a mix of older and newer technologies to help evolve them
  • Experience with Linux, server management, virtualization and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Master in Computer science or Engineering degree or related field

item.title: Product Specialist, Product, Innovation & Enablement - Digital Channel Analytics
item.description:
Description

#LI-hybrid

The Exclusive Partner Program (EPP) team works hand-in-hand with corporate organizations across Canada to provide their employees with value added services. This Mobility Marketing team is dynamic, driven, fast-paced, and highly engaged. Together, we are responsible for using a 4P approach to delivering profitable growth through one of the fastest growing segments of the TELUS mobility business. 

 

TELUS is a great place to work. You can see it in our team members. The diversity of the TELUS team and their unique contributions set us apart from the competition. Our success is based as much on our future friendly team as the innovative internet, voice, data and wireless products and solutions we offer.

 

Here’s what we will accomplish together:  #Li- remote 

 

This dynamic Product Specialist role on the EPP Product Innovation & Enablement team is responsible for supporting end-to-end internal omni-channel forecasting, performance tracking and optimization. As the EPP category grows and our channel strategy evolves to support it, you will grow to become our team’s trusted advisor by establishing a deep understanding of our digital-first channels. You will have the opportunity to build and leverage models and processes to support channel insights and prioritization. You will blend data, insights and storytelling expertise to inform the efficacy of integrated omni-channel programs, while also identifying opportunities to drive digital attribution and adoption metrics. In collaboration with various cross-functional partners across the service continuum, including Digital, Channel, Finance, Client Experience, etc., you will create structure around the planning and performance cycles that inform the decision-making and direction of key omni-channel initiatives. 

 

Here’s how:

 

  • Ownership of digital attribution across wireless EPP:
    • Forecasting on attributable volume and tracking (digital-start)
    • Target rationalization & planning (mitigation & stretch)
    • Manual SIM/Digital Commerce order tracking 
    • Data insights and reporting for lead management programs
    • CE inbound/frontline data integration (Tableau)
    • Digital Performance ownership: Dashboard creation and management (DOMO, New Relic, Adobe, etc.), Maintaining analytics dashboards & reporting views, self-serve reporting 
  • Funnel conversion analytics (submission tracking, drop-offs, etc.) through proprietary digital tools
  • Owning data-driven quickwins workstreams for continuous digital journey improvements
  • Use effective critical thinking and storytelling to explain digital attribution drivers and trending
  • Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders across TELUS Digital, Client Experience/Frontline, Marketing, Sales and Channel teams to solidify how we look at our digital mix for the category 

 

 

Qualifications

 

Here’s what YOU bring to this role:

 

  • Critical thinker - able to apply structured and analytical problem solving techniques to tackle unexpected challenges and opportunities
  • Strategic thinker - you have strong business and financial acumen and are able to analyze business cases, understand the business implications of decisions and provide guidance to stakeholders
  • Data guru - beyond having proficiency with MS Excel, you are curious and keen to work with other powerful DBMS and BI tools like Adobe Analytics, SFDC, Tableau, DOMO, and Google Cloud
  • Data-driven decision maker - identify gaps and use analytics to distill insights that allow you to make thoughtful, fulsome recommendations
  • Project manager - experience bringing complex solutions to market, while making the case for intelligent trade-offs between delivery time / quality / scope and cost
  • Communicator - develop clear, concise and compelling narratives

 

Great-to-haves:

 

  • Experience working with DBMS and BI tools such as DOMO, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, SFDC, Google Cloud, etc.
  • Educational background in Business, Economics, Data Science, or other related fields
  • Proven track record of driving a culture of high engagement and performance
  • B2B, B2B2C, telecommunications and/or technology-based industry experience is an asset

 

What WE Give Back to YOU:

 

  • Opportunity to show your stuff and be recognized and rewarded for excelling
  • Highly-engaged, dynamic and collaborative environment
  • Opportunities for personal development through training, networking and career development
  • An organization that actively supports you giving back to the community you live in
  • Competitive compensation and benefits
  • Place that embraces our core values: spirited Teamwork, courage to Innovate, embrace Change and initiate Opportunity, and a passion for Growth

item.title: Perception Autonomy Developer Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position:  Perception Autonomy Developer Co-op
Location:  Kitchener, Ontario            
Study Level: Senior 
Area of study: Computer Science/ Software Engineering, or similar  

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research products and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit https://ottomotors.com

About the Job

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms, all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, machine learning, computer vision and more.

The perception team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Perception Autonomy Developer you will work on the testing and development of core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic perception
  • Development of custom SLAM, computer vision, machine learning, target tracking and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new perception algorithms and sensing technology
  • Design and implement new perception systems and algorithms
  • Develop integration and unit tests for perception features
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems

Additional tasks may include:

  • Collaboration with internal teams including the Simulation Team and Navigation Team
  • Triage and support of live industrial systems in the field

Required Skills:

  • Practical and theoretical knowledge in at least one or more areas of: state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, machine learning, target detection and tracking, robotic perception
  • Strong software development skills in modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Excellent teamwork/communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop high quality software solutions

Bonus points for:

  • Hands-on experience with real autonomous systems
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • ROS, TensorFlow, Gazebo, and PCL experience
  • Familiarity with graph optimization techniques and libraries
  • Experience with git or other DVCS systems and other software development processes
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Autonomy Engineer - Perception
item.description:
Description

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms for navigation, collaboration, and control - all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, machine learning, computer vision and more.

The perception team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all of our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots. About You

You want to work for a company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, want to make a difference, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

  • Familiarity with graph optimization techniques and libraries
  • Experience with git/other DVCS systems and other software development processes
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Controls Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position:           Senior Controls Software Developer/Engineer

Location:          Kitchener, Ontario

Experience:     5+ years relevant work experience

Education:       Degree in a related field or equivalent work experience

Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We’re shipping more and more robots and seeing new uses for our products emerge every day!  We need an experienced Industrial Controls Engineer to help us take our innovative designs from napkin sketches to hundreds of pounds of precisely moving parts and facilitate every step in-between.

You will be responsible for the industrial controls system designs of existing and new industrial autonomous mobile robots.  This will range through the entire design process from initial concepting, requirements engineering, and cost forecasting, through to detailed design, verification and validation, and final release to production.  Design challenges will span across high-level system architecture, integration, programming, and field testing.

You will be responsible for significant portions of the controls and safety systems design and implementation for our new and existing products.  Our systems must be many things, but reliability is paramount. It will be your job to design and prototype control systems architectures which can operate in whatever environments and with whatever jobs we subject them to.

You will be a pioneer for new robot technologies at Clearpath leveraging both off-the-shelf and bespoke components. Sometimes those challenges will be “Can we do it?”, but other times those challenges will be “How do we do this right?”. All this will get us towards many new kinds of robots faster!

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Architecture and design of Industrial control systems, especially their software, to be compliant with relevant standards such as ISO 13849, ANSI B56.5, IEC 61508 and others as needed.
  • PLC and other industrial devices programming
  • First level of triage of problems to determine the root cause of complex mechatronic systems
  • Verifying and troubleshooting robot issues from software logs
  • Write and execute validation and test plans for PLC and safety functionality
  • Reviewing and releasing the configurations and firmware of various industrial devices
  • Contribute to component selection and evaluation 
  • New vehicle and controller bring-up, and prototype assembly
  • Design Documentation (Meeting minutes, requirements definition, architecture documents, internal troubleshooting guides, etc)
  • Be knowledgeable in the robot product lifecycle, and bring-in feedback from all relevant parties at the right time.

Additional tasks may include:

  • JIRA project task management
  • Robot configuration in a Linux environment
  • Supporting on-site troubleshooting and commissioning of prototype robotic vehicles at customer facilities. Occasional travel may be required (less than 5%)
  • Supporting product management with technical insight
  • Discovering and evaluating new technologies
  • Participating in productive technical planning sessions, both internally and with partner/client involvement
  • Support risk assessment and FMEDA activities

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven and view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have common sense to back it up.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • 5+ years relevant work experience
  • Degree/diploma in engineering, computer science, robotics, or a related field with applicable experience
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision while managing deadlines
  • Experience working with industrial automation systems in safety critical applications
  • Experience with hands-on prototyping and troubleshooting of mechatronic systems
  • Advanced PLC programming and troubleshooting, preferably with Siemens automation controllers and tools 
  • Familiarity with industrial fieldbus and network protocols, such as CAN, ModbusTCP, Profinet/Profisafe, etc.
  • Familiarity with Linux (Ubuntu) operating systems and basic command line interactions
  • Able to understand and communicate concepts readily via sketches, block diagrams, flow charts, and technical writing
  • Past experience participating in development or deployment projects that have gone terribly wrong
  • Able to cope with sudden jarring changes in projects, priorities, and the local gravity field.

Bonus points for:

  • IT experience in networking, OS configuration and troubleshooting, drivers
  • Experience with industrial electrical design and troubleshooting
  • Working knowledge of aspects of mobile robotics such as perception, planning, controls, and navigation
  • PLC development for serial OEM machines and equipment
  • Familiarity with industrial material handling vehicles, such as AGVs, AMRs, SDVs, forklifts, tuggers etc.
  • Experience with ROS (Robot Operating System)
  • Software development using Python or C++
  • Familiarity with software version control and CI/CD tools, such as Git, Jenkins and Gitlab

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Electrical Technologist
item.description:
Description

Position: Electrical Technologist  

Location: Kitchener, Ontario

Experience: 3+ years of relevant experience with robot deployment

Education: Technical diploma in Electrical Engineering or Electrician certification or equivalent

Division: OTTO Motors

 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

 

About the Job

You will be responsible for working with members of OTTO Motors’ electrical product team as we develop new vehicles for our expanding fleet. You will work with our Electrical Engineering team to develop electrical systems, help build the robots from the ground up,  repair robots, as well as maintain test equipment, and instrumentation. You will also help us continue to increase our test coverage and assist with engineering-led testing and service at client facilities. Finally, you will work with key members of the wider company to transition our work to the broader organization, including Testing, Quality, Production, Client Success, Professional Services, and other groups.

 

Primary responsibilities include:

  • On-the-fly wiring, assembly, and modification of a small quantity of large vehicles
  • Assist Electrical Engineers during verification and test procedures
  • Development of testing and documentation for vehicles and subsystems. 
  • Repair or replace various subsystems of the robot as needed.
  • Keeping engineering’s test/build facilities organized and maintained.

 

Additional tasks:

  • Any other design or development work which needs to be done which you are capable of.
  • Assisting the project team with initial test deployments
  • Support of initial systems alongside the rest of the project team
  • Support debugging of issues from harnesses, PCBA, or PLC

 

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

 

Required skills:

  • Possess skills in reading and interpreting technical drawings, electrical schematics prints, electrical and harness drawings. 
  • Experience in building and installing electrical harnesses and cables, connector and component selection, systems wiring. 
  • Has already encountered robots breaking in unpredictable ways at the worst possible times
  • Experience with getting technical multi-discipline tasks done quickly
  • Comfortable working in small groups with minimal oversight
  • Working knowledge in relation to safety when working with electrical and electronic equipment. 

 

Bonus points for one or more of the following:

  • Experience with Vesys and/or Altium
  • Electrical panel build experience is considered an asset.
  • Good attention to detail, organization, and time management skills.
  • Familiar with CSA/UL, NFPA and IPC Standards
  • Knowledge of PLCs
  • Past experience learning from development projects that have gone wrong
  • Basic ROS experience

 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Manager, Development Operations (DevOps)
item.description:
Description

Position:      Manager, Development Operations

Experience:   8 to 12 years

Education:    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant work experience

Division:       OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.
