item.title: Robot Platform Software Developer/Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position: Robot Platform Software Developer/Engineer

Location: Kitchener, Ontario

Experience: 3+ years

Education: Bachelor\'s degree in Mechatronics, Systems, Electrical Engineering, or a related field

Division: OTTO Motors

 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

 

About the Job

The Platform team is responsible for integrating Hardware and Software on the OTTO Mobile Autonomous Robot platforms.  You are a true Mechatronics engineer, with a focus primarily on the software side of things including bare metal firmware, device drivers for external components, and application layer components. You will lead in developing the software components to make our robots function, and easily diagnose issues. You will exemplify a proper Software Development Life Cycle from beginning to end and contribute to every aspect of it. Your code will ultimately run on the robots and control mission-critical functionality such as battery management, sensor drivers or motor command output. Any failure could have catastrophic consequences. 

You will be involved with the initial proof of concept and bring-up of new robot hardware platforms, integrating the hardware with the autonomous software.  You will be responsible for the controls system architecture and design of new and existing industrial self-driving vehicles.  Design challenges will span from high-level system architecture, integration, programming, and field testing. You have no problem deducing hardware issues from software logs. You will need to be aware of functional safety implications in an industrial environment, and how to implement and verify safety functions. 

 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Architect, design and implement custom software, ranging from low-level robot control firmware, PC drivers for external controllers, and enhanced interactive diagnostics using C/C++ and Python
  • Prototyping and Bring-up of new Mechatronic platforms
  • Integrating complex electronics and control systems with Autonomous Software
  • Documentation of system-level architectures, and contributing to knowledge bases for triaging and debugging complex issues
  • Providing expert level debugging of our robots to support Client Success, Field Services, and internal Test and Manufacturing teams

 

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Mechatronics engineering, Systems, Electrical Engineering, or a related field with applicable background
  • 3+ years of experience working with C++ and/or Python
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • Strong electronics and mechatronics prototyping and debugging skills (breadboarding, oscilloscopes, multimeters)
  • Experience of hands-on troubleshooting of electronic and electromechanical systems
  • Understanding of sensors and actuators and their error modes, especially motor controllers
  • Able to perform root-cause analysis of hardware and software issues from data logs
  • Familiarity with Linux (Debian based distributions)
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop software development plans, including timelines and test procedures
  • Past experience participating in development or deployment projects that have gone terribly wrong

 

Bonus Skills:

  • P.Eng Accreditation attained or in-progress

 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Financial Analyst / Business Analyst
item.description:
Description

Position:          Financial Analyst / Business Analyst

Location:          Kitchener, Ontario            

Experience:      3+ Years relevant experience

Education:       CPA Candidate, BBA or Masters of Accounting

Posting Both Clearpath and OTTO websites

 

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.and 

Clearpath Robotics Inc. (“Clearpath”) develops the future of robotics technology through industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath is an award-winning company - including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics,  is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through research and development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Finance Team

We are growing again and looking to add to our Team!  If you are aspiring to be a Financial Analyst / Business Analyst who thrives in a fast paced environment - we would like to help you grow in your career.  

Our track record for promoting from within and supporting individuals to reach their goals is part of what we do.  Reporting to the Director, Finance collaborating with the Finance and Operational Teams will provide you the opportunity to be an integral part of our business and the support to be an effective leader.       

About the Job - Primary Objectives

The ideal candidate is a person passionate about process, productivity and efficiency within a business - if that is you - this is the opportunity to develop seamless systems.  In addition to working closely with the Director, Finance and CFO to implement Finance and Operational initiatives, the Financial Analyst / Business Analyst will be responsible to work closely with our ERP Consultant to support the integration of the core ERP system and other ancillary software i.e. Salesforce, Bamboo HR, and other leading edge software.

 

You will have plenty of opportunities to collaborate with, and provide business decision support.  In addition, the position is responsible to:

  • Facilitate financial support of strategic projects 
  • Working collaboratively with the CFO, Director, Finance and Controller to implement digitization initiatives expanding the capacity and capabilities of the company, its divisions and the Finance Team
  • Strengthen the financial well-being of the Company by documenting systems that capture and build upon knowledge and follow good governance practices
  • Support risk mitigation strategies with the CFO and Commercial Contracts Manager

Strategy

  • Share analysis and recommendations to improve financial performance of the company 

 

Accounting and Reporting

  • Reconcile assigned general ledger accounts monthly and provide associated reporting and insights
  • Assist with the tracking and reporting of the Company’s employee stock option plan.
  • Assist with preparation of internal management accounting reports, external financial statements and reports as well as financial and other information for income tax reporting purposes.

Other Assignments 

  • Coach and develop Operational Teams to build ERP and system and financial knowledge and capabilities
  • Automate financing partners requests for information and reporting
  • Build virtual data rooms to support business grant and loan opportunities - collate grant application information and prepare periodic reports.
  • Implement system internal controls recommendations, ASPE compliance and applicable federal, provincial and local regulatory laws and rules
  • Contribute to the periodic and year end audits with the Finance Team and auditors.
  • Validate timecard data capture to support SR&ED claims 

Key Requirements

  • 5+ years experience in public accounting or high technology or manufacturing industry
  • BA in Accounting or Finance, CGA, CMA or CPA designation an asset
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization
  • Strong problem solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analyses. 
  • High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results-orientation.
  • High level of proficiency with software including ERP systems, Google Suite and Microsoft Office Word and Excel
  • Self motivated, highly organized and ability to work independently
  • Attention to detail but can see the big picture

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863

item.title: Robot Builder
item.description:
Description

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in assembling our core products along with their accessories.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to seeing a robotic platform from start to finish. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area.

This position requires the worker to be on site for the full daily shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Electromechanical Assembly of robotic platforms 
    • Use of hand tools
    • Use of hoisting equipment
    • Cable installation and wire routing
  • Rotating throughout different assembly stations to achieve cross-training among team members
  • Ensuring your workspace follows 5S guidelines
  • Using a computer for work instructions via VKS system
  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance
  • Other duties as assigned

About You:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on manual product assembly
  • Wiring or cable installation experience preferred
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, and electric drills.
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and GSuite
  • Able to work the Day shift Hours 7am - 3pm Monday to Friday
  • Positive and professional attitude with safety mindset
  • Proven ability to work independently
  • Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
  • Ability to follow written assembly work instructions in English
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs comfortably 

Bonus points for:

  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance
  • Hobbies that involve assembly with hand tools, car maintenance for instance
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology
  • Previously being part of a Health & Safety Committee

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
  • Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
  • Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Friendly and fun co-workers!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Marketing Manager (Fixed-Term Contract)
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position:             Marketing Manager (12-Month Fixed Term Contract)

Location:            Waterloo, Ontario

Experience:        5+ years relevant experience in Marketing

Education:          BSc/BA or diploma in marketing, business, communications, or equivalent

 

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.


About the Job:

In your role as Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing, planning and implementing marketing initiatives that promote brand awareness, engage the robotics research and development community and drive demand for Clearpath robotic platforms, autonomy software and services.  The ideal candidate will have passion for technology and working collaboratively across the organization to achieve common goals.  


Responsibilities include:

  • Generate new business opportunities through targeted, multi-faceted marketing tactics and campaigns
  • Own the overall marketing strategy and oversee the planning, development and implementation of marketing programs, campaigns and initiatives. 
  • Manage the inbound marketing and content marketing strategy including the ideation, planning, development and implementation of online marketing content including videos, blog posts, white papers, webinars, podcasts & more.
  • Manage the development and dissemination of sales and marketing collateral, media and other digital assets.  
  • Manage the events marketing strategy including the planning, coordination and attendance of industry conferences and trade shows. 
  • Manage the digital marketing strategy including overseeing social media accounts, lead nurturing campaigns,  company newsletter and websites to engage customers, prospects and the overall robotics community. 
  • Collaborate with strategic partners and Value Added Resellers (VARs) on joint marketing campaigns and initiatives.  
  • Gather customer and market insights to inform outreach strategies, increase customer conversions, and generate more qualified leads.
  • Identify effectiveness and impact of current marketing initiatives with tracking and analysis, and optimize accordingly.
  • Present ideas and final deliverables to internal and external teams, and communicate with senior leaders about marketing programs, strategies, and budgets
  • Manage and administer marketing tools and tech stack including Hootsuite, Pardot, Salesforce and Vidyard.
  • Work closely with agencies, and cross-functional teams in the creation of communication ideas, plans and tactics. 
  • Lead, inspire and collaborate with marketing team 
  • Project management, budget management and scheduling.

About you:

You want to work for a company with a vision to impact the world.  You are a leader and natural collaborator - a highly driven, high energy person that views work as more than just a job. You’re a big-picture thinker that possesses a unique blend of both business and technical savvy.  You are never satisfied with a project left half-done and want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. 


You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  Oh, and you have some combination of experience, higher education, and common sense to back it up.


Marketers come from various backgrounds, therefore, most importantly we are looking for someone who matches the description above and is looking to take on the world.  That being said we consider these baseline for our next team member:

  • 5+ years direct marketing management experience
  • Business, Marketing, or Creative background
  • A proven track record of launching great products
  • Unusually great organizational and time management skills
  • Excellent in both verbal and visual communication
  • Collaborative to your core
  • Strong B2B marketing experience
  • Experience marketing software to the industrial space

Bonus points for:

  • Experience building robots, self-driving vehicles, or cloud based software
  • Previous experience introducing disruptive technology to the market
  • Adobe Creative Suite experience 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.description:
Description

Experience:       5+ Years relevant experience

Education:         Bachelors or equivalent experience

Division:            OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job:

We are seeking a Technical Writer to join its highly skilled team in Kitchener, Canada.  At Clearpath we believe that every client is a VIP and we need someone who will obsessively focus on making our customers successful.

You will produce high-quality documentation that contributes to the overall success of our products. You will work collaboratively with developers, quality engineers, product managers, client success representatives and usability experts to make our products easier to use.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Work with internal teams to obtain an in-depth understanding of the product and its documentation requirements
  • Produce high-quality documentation that meets applicable standards and is appropriate for its intended audience
  • Write easy-to-understand user interface text, online help, and developer guides
  • Analyze existing and potential content, focusing on reuse and single-sourcing opportunities
  • Create and maintain the information architecture

About You:

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.   Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Requirements: 

  • 5 years’ related work experience
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Ability to translate technical lingo into relatable, digestible content
  • Keen eye for detail
  • Basic grasp of technology, machines, sensors, and software products
  • Naturally friendly, energetic, and empathetic personality
  • Well organized and responsive
  • Passionate about making people happy through exceptional service
  • Self-starter able to work with minimal supervision

Nice to Haves:

  • If you’ve got experience with robotics, ROS, or Ubuntu, that’s icing on the cake!
  • Knowledge of Jira Service Desk or other web-based knowledge base systems
  • Knowledge of Confluence, Paligo
  • Experience in HTML, PHP, CSS

item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:             Product Manager

Location:            Kitchener, Ontario

Experience:        3 Years of relevant work experience

Education:         Bachelors Degree

Division:             OTTO Motors

Type:                  Full-Time Permanent

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com. 

About the Opportunity:

We are looking for a product manager to add to our growing team. We need someone with a track record of success bringing great products to market. An ideal candidate has experience bringing enterprise-grade software to market, comes from an automation background or really understands the industrial automation, manufacturing, or distribution space.

 

You will be responsible for a critical part of our portfolio in material movement and your experience in product management will help you drive the products’ success. You will work closely with the rest of the OTTO product development team to make sure that we are delivering properly engineered solutions. You will work closely with both sales and marketing to ensure your products are competitive, valuable and understood in the marketplace.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to product strategy, vision, and execution of our software to ensure the health, well-being and happiness of our robots.
  • Build a detailed near- and long-term product roadmap. Validate with key customers and stakeholders.
  • Translate software requirements into product deliverables and drive them to completion
  • Work closely with the engineering team to deliver great software solutions
  • Act as a product evangelist internally and externally champion the best in class material movement platform
  • Be the expert on the competition and how to beat them.

Required Experience/Skills:

Product Managers come from various backgrounds, therefore, most importantly we are looking for someone who matches the description above and is looking to take on the world. That being said we consider these baselines for our next team member:

  • You have been building software products for a while and have 3 years’ experience shipping products as a product manager
  • You have a degree or diploma in Business or Engineering related fields
  • You have worked with engineering teams as a product owner and have demonstrable experience leading cross-functional teams to define, execute and iterate on projects
  • You are adept at both verbal and visual communication and can lead teams through difficult decisions.
  • You have a demonstrable track record shipping high-quality product, and can excel in product design when required
  • You can break down strategy into tactics and tactics into metrics

What’s in it for you:

  • Meaningfully contribute to a compelling vision
  • Work-life balance (flexible hours)
  • Competitive compensation
  • Health benefits
  • Career development
  • Equity 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

Division:             OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • understanding customer requirements and ensuring clarity of all requirements prior to proceeding with the detailed design;
  • consulting with applications engineering during the requirements and concept definition process; documenting/updating the requirements when needed
  • detailed design & integration of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes design of the workflow as well as the communications required from our system to any third party automation systems in the facility where the system is being installed
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above

Additional responsibilities include:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~30 - 40 % travel commitment (NOTE: No travel outside of North America currently with the COVID-19 travel restrictions)

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

As an experienced Systems Engineer you believe that the final product is more than the sum of its component parts and live in this area of optimising the intersection of the components. You are no stranger to the intricacies of engineering compromise and the need to consider all aspects of the whole when crafting the ultimate fulfillment of the system requirements. Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end user systematically.

Required background:

  • 5+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users

Required skills:

  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail
  • ability to navigate through and program PLCs
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics

Bonus for experience:

  • data analysis experience
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other
  • experience with inductive automation ignition OPC/UA software
  • familiarity of working with Linux

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Systems Integration Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position:              Systems Integration Engineer        
Location:             USA - Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky, Illinois     
Experience:        3+ years of relevant work experience (IC3 Intermediate)
Education:          Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial Controls/Mechatronics/Systems Engineering related field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities:

  • detailed design of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes workflow design, attachment design, map design and development/modification middle layer software logic using Ignition OPC/UA and/or PLC logic design and modification
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • commissioning & integration of AMR systems at client facilities throughout the world; this includes traveling to customer or integration partner facility for on-site deployment and integration with facility side automation equipment
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • troubleshooting software & hardware technical issues using internal tools available; solving new and challenging technical problems related to the above

Additional responsibilities:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~35 - 45 % travel commitment over the year (travel mostly contained to Canada and USA).  Trips to site would typically be 2 weeks on - 2 weeks off during the project integration phase.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end-user systematically.

Required background:

  • 3+ years of relevant work experience
  • 3+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users
  • experience in troubleshooting and repairing electro-mechanical systems/subsystems
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • PLC design and integration experience
  • demonstrated ability to work with Linux
  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail

Bonus for experience:

  • training users of automated equipment/software
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)
  • experience with inductive Automation Ignition OPC/UA software
  • Have Spanish as first, second or third language.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Technical Support Specialist (Rotating Shifts)
item.description:
Description

Position:      Technical Support Specialist
Location:     Kitchener
Job  Type:   Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 3+ years customer-facing work experience
Education:   Bachelors in related field
Division:      OTTO Motors 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath is seeking a Technical Support Specialist to join our highly skilled team in Kitchener. At
Clearpath we believe that every client is a VIP and we need someone who will obsessively focus on
making our customers successful.
You will be responsible for providing remote post-sales customer service and technical support to
our rapidly growing list of customers globally.  Don’t worry if you encounter a complex technical
challenge, we have a team of insanely smart robotics engineers (the brain surgeons of robotics!)
who will help you troubleshoot.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

 Advanced Level technical support to our customers
 On-call Escalation Support
 Organizing warranty parts and repairs
 Triage and customer assistance
 Escalating tickets and coordinating engineering teams with support efforts
 On-boarding new customers
 Acting as a customer advocate internally
 Chasing down a solution internally to a deployed customers issue
 Supporting our partners deploying systems at new customer sites

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view
work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be
surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are
motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding
problems.   Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Client-facing Skills:
 5+ years customer-facing work experience
 Strong communicator (written and verbal), with excellent phone and email manners
 Naturally friendly, energetic and empathetic personality
 Well organized and responsive, with great problem solving and negotiation skills
 Passionate about making people happy through exceptional service
 Basic grasp of technology and robotics
 Solid grasp of software architecture, and IT systems
 Communicating technical ideas in an easy to understand way

Technical Skills:
 Hardware/Electrical hands-on troubleshooting
 Computer networking and applicable industrial standards
 Data analytics

Bonus points for:
 Linux (Ubuntu), C, C++, Python
 ROS knowledge
 Ability to work evenings 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and
accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry,
disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and
expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Sales Solutions Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position:              Sales Solutions Engineer (Clearpath Robotics, Research Solutions)       
Location:             Waterloo, Ontario              
Experience:        3+ years\' experience
Division:              Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job 

Clearpath Robotics’ Research Systems team is looking for a well organized, relationship-oriented Sales Solutions Engineer with proven skills across all account functions: business development, direct technical sales, and account management.

As our newest Sales Solutions Engineer, your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Review client projects and applications, and assist in the scoping & configuration of application-appropriate robotic solutions for customers, independently and in collaboration with our team of Engineers 
  • Gains customer acceptance by explaining or demonstrating product features and software
  • Submits orders by conferring with technical support staff and costing engineering changes.
  • Provide company, product, and technical overview presentations
  • Provide pre-sales quotes to customers in a timely manner
  • Check purchase orders for accuracy against the quote or standards before processing Provide technical assistance to the customers - answering technical queries and perform research when answers are not immediately available
  • Successfully promote and sell Clearpath as a full-service robotic solutions provider
  • Maintain and develop a high level of knowledge of new technology and the company’s solution offerings
  • Contributes to sales engineering effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed, 

About You

Our next Sales Solutions Engineer is a sharp, articulate and collaborative person, who is 100% comfortable spending their days talking to everyone from grad students to CEOs to rocket scientists. You dream of being part of a close-knit sales team that attacks new challenges with a bear hug and thrives equally on collaboration and friendly competition.

You have an innate drive to be successful, and you bring both the acumen and the grit to achieve your objectives.

Our ideal candidate is someone who is described by friends as:

  • Entrepreneurial and resourceful
  • A confident and articulate speaker with the ability to think on their feet
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Able to understand and communicate technical concepts
  • Exceptional organization and attention to detail
  • Dynamic, dependable and diligent
  • Highly motivated and self-starting
  • Passion for helping customers solve complex problems with innovative technology

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 3 years’ experience of proven excellence in business development, inside sales and/or sales
  • Technical degree or equivalent experience
  • Ability to translate technology features into business benefits
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong initiative and ability to work in a self-directed environment
  • Organization and priority setting skills and ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity and expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Account Executive
item.description:
Description

Position:          Account Executive 
Location:          Remote - North America
Experience:      5 + Years’ experience selling technical products, preferably material handling solutions
Division:          OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath is automating the world and we need your help.  Got what it takes?

We’re looking for a passionate, self-driven, and motivated Account Executive (AEx) to join our OTTO Motors Sales Organization. We strive to become the ‘renaissance people’ of deal-making, with proven skills across all account functions: strategic account planning, business development, direct technical sales, and account administration. This is a remote position, with 50% travel required – you will receive support from the team regardless of location.

You will:

  • Pursue target accounts in your territory, infiltrate those accounts at the highest decision-making level, and secure that business.
  • Devise account strategies that leverage OTTO solutions and go-to-market strategy to expand OTTO within target accounts
  • Develop business relationships across the organization elevating Clearpath’s position within the executive ranks. 
  • Work with clients to identify materials handling automation opportunities in their facilities, promote and demonstrate the OTTO solution and engage the customers in projects with compelling business cases.    
  • Be responsible for pipeline growth and revenue growth in your territory.
  • Devise your personal strategy to systematically conquer your slice of the globe... and we will do everything we can to support you along the way!  
  • The AEx reports directly to the Director of Sales. You will be paid a base salary plus commissions and benefits.

Ideal Sales Characteristics:

Our next AEx is a sharp, articulate and persuasive person, who is 100% comfortable spending their days talking to highly-technical Production Engineers, Facility Directors and VP and C Level Executives.

  • Coachability – ability to understand feedback and change behavior
  • Curiosity – ability and desire to ask probing questions
  • Prior Success – based on previous sales results and/or ambition
  • Intelligence – ability to become a subject matter expert
  • Emotional Intelligence – self-awareness, self-management, social awareness and relationship building with others 
  • Passion – brings an intense enthusiasm to the team
  • Work Ethic – willingness to put in the extra effort to succeed
  • Preparation – technical aptitude of product and market/buyer understanding
  • Competitiveness – a drive to succeed that enables higher performance
  • Adaptability - ability to adapt and succeed in a fast-paced environment
  • Culture Fit – fit with company core values and culture

Required Skills and Experience: 

  • University degree in a STEM, Business or related field
  • Minimum 5+ years of relevant industry experience in a variety of technical roles including Applications Engineering, Project/Program Management and Technical Sales
  • Proven success in Business Development, Direct Sales and/or Key Account Management
  • Experience selling to mid market and enterprise organizations
  • Experience with CRM products such as Salesforce.com is an asset
  • Excellent communication skills, and the ability to deliver compelling presentations to prospects, customers, and partners.
  • Strategic thinker who is also hands-on to get results
  • Ability to travel to customers 25-50% of the time.

What’s in it for you:

  • Work-life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Customer Engineer, Data Analytics, Public Sector
item.description:
2022-05-23T21:32:01.259Z

Customer Engineer, Data Analytics, Public Sector

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience with cloud computing (e.g., cloud market) and delivering technical presentations.
  • Experience with analytic warehouse solutions, “Big Data” technologies, real time streaming, performance, and scalability optimizations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • Technical sales experience in the fields of cloud computing, data, information lifecycle management, and Big Data.
  • Experience in writing code in a common development languages such as Java, Python, JavaScript, C++, Scala, R, or Go.
  • Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch, or real-time event processing and exact transform and load (ETL) workflows solutions (e.g., Informatica, Talend, Alooma, SAP, Data Services).
  • Knowledge of Linux and an ability to address domain name systems, transmission control protocol, firewalls, proxy servers, load balancing, virtual private network, and virtual private cloud.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Customer Engineer, you will work with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective and existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections, and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
  • Manage the technical relationship with Google’s customers (e.g., managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources).
  • Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer and partner environments.
  • Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Cloud Platform value proposition, using techniques that include presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, and request for information response documents.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other events.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

  • Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections, and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
  • Manage the technical relationship with Google’s customers (e.g., managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources).
  • Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer and partner environments.
  • Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Cloud Platform value proposition, using techniques that include presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, and request for information response documents.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other events.

item.title: Enterprise Customer Specialist, Business Application Platform, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-06-09T19:32:05.536Z

Enterprise Customer Specialist, Business Application Platform, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience as a technical sales specialist in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role.
  • Experience with web services and API technologies such as HTTP, SOAP and REST.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in areas such as API management, microservice frameworks, and PaaS.
  • Experience with legacy and modern application development, container orchestration systems, middleware technologies, or other applicable platforms..
  • Knowledge of end-to-end security and understanding of popular API security technologies such as OAuth, mTLS, SAML, JWT, and SSO.
  • Understanding of cloud, multi/hybrid-cloud strategies and associated technologies.
  • Ability to travel as needed, and to work flexible hours with prospects in different geographies/with a distributed team.

About the job

Apigee Edge is an advanced API platform that enables enterprises to create, manage, secure and scale APIs. Using Apigee, enterprises can design and deploy API proxies in public and private clouds, secure data in transit with OAuth 2.0, SAML and two-way TLS, protect against traffic spikes by adding dynamic routing, caching and rate-limiting policies to APIs, and measure the success of both API operations and API business with end-to-end analytics.

As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help businesses of all sizes leverage technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

Adopting cloud and modernizing IT are the priorities for enterprises as they look to be successful and competitive in this digital world. To drive this transformation, enterprises are increasingly adopting API-first approaches connecting services across hybrid and multi-cloud environments. Google Cloud\'s Apigee empowers organizations to accelerate their business by unlocking the value of data, driving internal efficiencies, and delivering modern applications.

As an Enterprise Customer Specialist, you will influence and lead enterprise customers through their transformation journey. You\'ll liaise with the Product Management and Development teams to stay up-to-date with industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products. You will help prospective and existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential technical roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Provide API management and application modernization expertise to support the technical relationship with Google’s customers.
  • Work with the account team to identify and qualify business opportunities. Understand key customer objections and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
  • Develop Proofs of Concept, presentations, and demos with a clear plan to take a prospect successfully through the evaluation process and provide excellent customer service.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required.
  • Partner directly with Product Management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to Google Cloud.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

item.title: Partner Operations Manager, Music, YouTube
item.description:
2022-04-29T16:31:57.431Z

Partner Operations Manager, Music, YouTube

  • YouTube
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience in customer support or client services experience troubleshooting and resolving customer issues.
  • Experience working in the Music industry, with Music stakeholders, or in Music Rights Management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge of data analytics, data visualization, spreadsheets, and/or SQL.
  • Knowledge of the Canadian Music industry and current Canadian policies.
  • Ability to troubleshoot complex, technical issues.
  • Ability to be proactive, making constructive suggestions, and coming up with innovative ways to scale initiatives.
  • Ability to manage competing priorities and multiple clients.

About the job

As a member of the Partner Operations team, you\'ll analyze top issues facing our content creators, work with cross-functional teams to resolve them, and help manage support operations. Whether directly engaging with our biggest creators, surfacing problems to our technical teams, driving analytical insights, or liaising with vendors to provide stellar support, you\'ll drive reach, satisfaction, and resolution — making YouTube an exceptional user experience for everyone.

In this role, you will provide YouTube support to some of our managed Label partners. You will become a YouTube product expert, solve the day-to-day issues of our Music partners, and identify common trends that our partners face. You will also be responsible for advocating on behalf of our partners to cross-functional teams in order to drive product solutions, and for developing process improvements that enhance internal operations. You will work closely with other partner-facing teams to provide value-add services to help increase our Music partner\'s growth.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

Responsibilities

  • Provide operational support to managed partners on the YouTube platform, primarily through email communication.
  • Serve as a consultant to internal, cross-functional stakeholders on the YouTube product. Work with assigned Strategic Partner Managers and Partner Technology Managers to develop business plans and share insights for partner growth.
  • Drive, measure, and analyze overall partner performance as well as streamline operational workflows and process improvements.
  • Contribute to scaling Partner Operations for YouTube through innovation, efficiency gains, and root cause analysis.
  • Evaluate data both quantitatively and qualitatively, and use data to visually tell a compelling story.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

item.title: Customer Solutions Developer, Google Technical Professional Services
item.description:
2022-05-13T14:31:44.944Z

Customer Solutions Developer, Google Technical Professional Services

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
  • 2 years of experience working with web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and/or HTTP)
  • Experience coding with a programming language (e.g., Java, C/C++, Python)

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with and managing internal and external partners/customers
  • Experience with the ad serving industry and internet technologies, data integration projects, and cloud technologies
  • Ability to adapt a message to the technical level of an audience and present technical materials to groups of any size
  • Excellent problem solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent attention to detail and project management skills

About the job

gTech’s Professional Services team takes a creative, collaborative, and customer-centric approach to provide foundational services and forward-looking business solutions to top advertiser and publisher customers. Through technical implementation, optimization, and key solutions, gTech Professional Services helps customers attain their business goals while building long-term capabilities.

In this role, you will develop innovative solutions to the business problems faced by advertisers. You will work as a critical technical partner for our Sales teams. You will develop solutions that will take many forms, from prototypes and demos to education all with the technology resources of Google to back it up. Seeing the unique business challenges faced by our advertisers, you will be identifying and prioritizing projects and will be developing solutions. Working across the entire organization, you will leverage your wide-ranging experience and skill-set to find the best solution for the problems.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with customers to understand underlying business challenges.
  • Build relationships with the Sales team and customers, then leverage these relationships to identify and develop innovative technical solutions that lead to more advertising business.
  • Design, create, and present prototypes, demos, and proofs-of-concept to a wide variety of audiences, from Developers to Marketing. Leverage Google’s Cloud infrastructure and big data analytics systems to achieve goals.
  • Provide technical consulting services and guidance around Google APIs and Google Cloud platforms to help clients develop applications across products.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

item.title: Developer Relations Specialist, Reliable Software Delivery and Operations
item.description:
2022-04-29T15:32:01.033Z

Developer Relations Specialist, Reliable Software Delivery and Operations

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
  • + 1 more location
Apply

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Toronto, ON, Canada; Kitchener, ON, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Developing, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience
  • 3 years of experience developing, delivering, and/or operating business software

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience speaking at technology conferences, blogging/writing technical articles, or contributing to open source projects
  • Experience interfacing with customers including technical practitioners, managers, department heads, and executives
  • Experience helping develop and grow collaborative and inclusive teams
  • Experience with infrastructure such as code, software delivery pipelines, and monitoring production environments
  • Ability to work globally and collaboratively in a team environment and to influence technical practitioners, stakeholders, and globally distributed teams

About the job

The Customer Advocacy team is made up of technical practitioners with experience building, deploying, and operating applications in Google Cloud. We inspire, educate, and enable customers to transform the way they achieve their technology-enabled business goals. We improve teams\' capabilities, allowing them to experience the benefits of using Google Cloud.

The Cloud Developer Relations team consists of members from a wide range of technology roles including Software Developers, Data Scientists and Developers, Machine Learning Scientists, System Administrators, Site Reliability Developer, and Cloud Developers who combine their domain expertise with a desire to help Google Cloud build products and solutions that are important to their own communities and that solve their problems in simple, scalable, and innovative ways.

As a Cloud Developer Relations Specialist, you will build narratives and experiences that connect Google Cloud products and services to the principles, practices, and capabilities that drive reliable software delivery and operations performance. You will guide and amplify practitioner-led organizational transformation with teams working for Google Cloud customers.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in Developer Operations, Site Reliability Developing, security, and/or programming language communities as a direct practitioner.
  • Work with research, product, and developing teams on product strategies and narratives around new products and features.
  • Provide technical contributions in the form of open source software, product enhancements, and product design. Coach teams on improving their reliable software delivery and operations performance.
  • Create original content to inspire usage of Google Cloud leading to more reliable software delivery and operations performance.
  • Advocate for practitioners internally and influence Google Cloud product strategy by working with Product Management, Developing, Public Relations, Marketing, Business Development, and other cross-functional teams.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. The Cloud Developer Relations team consists of members from a wide range of technology roles including Software Developers, Data Scientists and Developers, Machine Learning Scientists, System Administrators, Site Reliability Developer, and Cloud Developers who combine their domain expertise with a desire to help Google Cloud build products and solutions that are important to their own communities and that solve their problems in simple, scalable, and innovative ways.

As a Cloud Developer Relations Specialist, you will build narratives and experiences that connect Google Cloud products and services to the principles, practices, and capabilities that drive reliable software delivery and operations performance. You will guide and amplify practitioner-led organizational transformation with teams working for Google Cloud customers.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in Developer Operations, Site Reliability Developing, security, and/or programming language communities as a direct practitioner.
  • Work with research, product, and developing teams on product strategies and narratives around new products and features.
  • Provide technical contributions in the form of open source software, product enhancements, and product design. Coach teams on improving their reliable software delivery and operations performance.
  • Create original content to inspire usage of Google Cloud leading to more reliable software delivery and operations performance.
  • Advocate for practitioners internally and influence Google Cloud product strategy by working with Product Management, Developing, Public Relations, Marketing, Business Development, and other cross-functional teams.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. item.title: Technical Writer, Internal Developer Relations
item.description:
2022-03-28T22:31:40.217Z

Technical Writer, Internal Developer Relations

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience creating content for a technical audience (e.g., developer documentation, Computer Science course materials, and/or IT administrative playbooks).
  • Experience with technologies (e.g., software or hardware systems) by investigation, direct experimentation (e.g., reading or running code), and/or interactions with Subject Matter Experts.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience writing for an Android developer audience or writing code for Android.
  • Experience writing content for an audience of software developers.
  • Experience researching and writing effective documentation for developers.
  • Understanding of data pipeline concepts.
  • Proficiency in a UNIX environment.

About the job

We are engaged, innovative, growth-oriented technical writers who want to change the world with great documentation for Google engineers.

This is a technical writing individual contributor role in the Analytics, Logging, and Experiments space in Core Developer. You will be working on end-to-end performance analytics solution for first-party Android apps. With this role, you\'ll have the opportunity for cross-functional interactions with Software Developers, Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, Program Managers, and members of developer relations staff like instructional designers and more.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with project teams to understand documentation requirements.
  • Design information architecture for complex documentation sets.
  • Facilitate, edit, and curate documentation produced by product managers and developers.
  • Develop documentation content in partnership with technical staff.
  • Advocate for users, and influence product design and implementation.
